questions.question: What's most exciting to you in terms of collecting the biological data about a human being?
If you're running a hospital and you can save $2,000 per cardiac patient, what are you gonna do?
How many billions, if not trillions of dollars will that save over the next decade?
Is there something you could say about the kinds of diets that may improve longevity, but also enable calorie restriction?
Is it difficult to eat a plant-based diet that you perform well under, so mentally and physically?
Is there something you could say about the mind and stress, in terms of the effect on longevity, sort of?
I mean, why does it matter how many times the Earth's gone around the sun, seriously?
The average lifespan of a human that looks after themselves but doesn't pay attention is about 80, okay?
